description: From Middle English harpere, from Old English hearpere (“harpist, harper”), equivalent to harp +‎ -er. Cognate with Middle Low German harpære (“harper”), German Harfer and Harfner (“harper”).

entries.meaning: A harpist, especially one who plays a traditional harp without pedals.
(obsolete) An old Irish brass coin bearing the emblem of a harp.
examples: the harper that was gathered amongst us to pay the piper
